text:
The Environment Agency has been awarded ¬£1.4 million to plant more than 850,000 treesüå≥

The trees will protect around 160km of river and help to reduce the risk of flooding to over 500 properties.

RT @BrunelFlood_Eng: #Flooding affects millions worldwide and the future needs more engineers. 

Join @BrunelUni and @EnvAgency on Friday 1‚Ä¶
@EnvAgencyMids great work again
RT @EnvAgencyMids: Great work going on in #ChelmsleyWood https://t.co/URGNaiZ6L6

@barnowlterry @CraigBennett3 @IoloWilliams2 @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK @WildlifeTrusts You're clearly a nature lover (judging by your feed). What makes you think this is better? This kind of work destroys niches for hundreds of species, makes rivers extremely poor compared to what they should be, and what's more it doesn't even necessarily help with flooding.

#Flooding affects millions worldwide and the future needs more engineers. 

Join @BrunelUni and @EnvAgency on Friday 11 Dec 10am BST to hear what it‚Äôs like to study a sponsored degree in Flood and Coastal Engineering and ask questions.  

Register now: https://t.co/SCyzVeQUb8 https://t.co/gyREs0SI4u

@RobStoneman @HerefordshireWT @EnvAgency The farmer had an application for 19 houses turned down this year. And the report on the planning (Herefordshire 200367) highlighted his duties to protect the river and wildlife.

@CumbriaRain @EnvAgencyNW @metoffice As well it is the shape of the gauge that is important. "Chimney" shaped gauges like these can produce an updraft that creates turbulence, thereby preventing the rain actually getting in. We did field trials on this in the UK and CFD analysis with the WMO centre in Genoa Italy. https://t.co/uk5EBN9Cv7
